labels.analysis: The MCP Server GOAT is designed to facilitate interactions with blockchain networks, specifically Ethereum and ERC-20 tokens. Its tools primarily focus on wallet management, token operations, and blockchain transactions, providing a user-friendly interface for managing cryptocurrency assets and performing various blockchain-related operations.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of this server is to manage blockchain assets, which aligns most closely with the "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" category. The tools cover essential operations like token transfers, balance checks, and transaction approvals, which are central to cryptocurrency management. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" could apply due to the ability to look up token information, though this is less central. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the functionality.

tools.description: Get the balance of an ERC20 token in base units. Convert to decimal units before returning.

tokenAddress.description: The address of the token to get the balance of

decimals.description: The number of decimals of the token

server_info_crawled.name: GOAT
server_info_crawled.author: @goat-sdk/goat
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect your blockchain applications with Claude for Desktop. Easily manage ERC-20 tokens and interact with various blockchain networks through a user-friendly interface.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@goat-sdk/goat/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
